data.title: Content, sort order of task generation list
data.body:
Testing #4019 
- does anyone use Jake?  can we remove this?
- what is the sort order?  Should be alphabetical.
- change "External Command" to "Other" with a description of "Creates a generic task to run any external command"

data.title: task.json creation, rename ".Net" to ".NET"

testing #4019 

".Net" should be ".NET"

data.title: task.json creation, rename ".Net" to ".NET"
javascript validation is not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: OSX 
#4022

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a new file, add a workspace setting to enable javascript validation `"javascript.validate.enable": false`
2. in the file type: 

``` javascript
var str = "qrqweqwewqe"; 
str.test(); 
```

Expected: error under test since test method is not defined on a string.

data.title: -w options is not working as expected in Windows git config
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows-10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try code-alpha -w on windows, it works as expected. 
2. Setup vscode to be the default git config editor as described in #4006
3. run `git config --global -e`

Expected:
Code opens the git config to edit

Actual:

```
/c/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Alpha/bin/code-alpha: line 7: realpath:
 command not found
/c/Program Files (x86)/Microsoft VS Code Alpha/bin/code-alpha: line 10: ./Code -
 Alpha.exe: No such file or directory
error: There was a problem with the editor 'code-alpha --wait'.

```

data.title: Feature Request: Ability to specify the working directory for a task
data.body: It would be nice if I could specify the working directory for a task without needing to create a separate script or anything. For example, on my current project I need to run the build system from one of my project's subfolders, and it would be nice if I could just invoke it without a script that changes directories first.

data.title: No option for excluding a folder from ctrl-p and search results, but still shown on left-nav.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:
Add "node_modules" and "lib" to files.exclude

Expected:
shown in leftnav but excluded from ctrl-p and search, but still in the left nav

Resulted:
excluded in ctrl-p and search, but also the left nav

There is files.exclude and search.exclude, but no filelist.exclude or something... If search.exclude would exclude the file from showing up in ctrl-p, that would be another fine alternative.

data.title: Duplicate identifier error after moving a typescript file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.10
- OS Version: Windows 10

Typescript says things are duplicate when i move a file around.
My guess is that the location of the file is not updated in the typescript service properly because when i restart VSCode it fixes itself but still its annoying to have to restart the editor.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. get a large typescript code base like react.d.ts or something similar
2. move it
3. watch it happen

data.title: JS syntax highlighting not working as expected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 0.10.10 / 5b5f4db87c10345b9d5c8d0bed745bcad4533135
- OS Version: Mac OS X Yosemite 10.10.5 / 14F1605
## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Save a new file with a `.js` extension
2. Add some JS code
## Expected

I'll see a full range of syntax highlighting
## Actual

![highlighting sample](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/829827/13761678/952a5f68-ea10-11e5-9953-b45ccd5ccbf6.png)

I'm surprised that keywords like `var`, `let`, `const`, and `function` are not being highlighted. 

I've seen this on other people's machines as well.

I can't imagine that I'm the first one to notice this. Is this by design? Is there some JS support extension I'm supposed to install?

Maybe this issue should be going to microsoft/vscode-textmate but I'm not sure.

Thanks!

data.title: OS Language not detected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-Alpha
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan 10.11.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run your OS in German
2. Open VS Code

I expect to see German translated strings. I see English. From test issue #4018

data.title: Building VS Code - Importing a npm module
data.body: I was trying to understand how to import a npm module into vscode.  So far I have added added the npm module to `package.json` with `./scripts/npm.sh install modulename --save`.  I have added it also to `gulpfile.vscode.js` to the array `baseModules`.  I have created a typings file for it as well but when I run `gulp watch` and `./scripts/code.sh` I keep getting an error saying my npm module that I am trying to use does not exist.  What is the correct steps to import and use a npm module?

data.title: Typescript intellisense doesn't work for files listed in tsconfig.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.10
- OS Version: OS X Yosemite

Intellisense doesn't work when i manually list files in "files" directive in tsconfig.json. Sample project https://github.com/RANUX/vscode-ts-project-tests 
First i created tsconfig.json:

```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "module": "system",
    "target": "es5"
  },
  "files": [
    "typings/meteor/meteor.d.ts"
  ]
}
```

Then i created file "typings/meteor/meteor.d.ts" with type definitions for Meteor and started to write code in other .ts file. After that i tried to access to Meteor declaration in my new .ts file, but found that intellisense doesn't work.

data.title: Check casing of locale string with module resolution and loader names
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: all

Currently the nls bundles are generated with filename where locale information is all lower case. However the country/dialect part of a locale (e.g. CH in de-CH) is usually specified using uppercase characters which is not matching the file on disk if the disk is case sensitive (e.g. Linux and may be MAC). The needs to be changes and tested on both Chinese locales since they have a dialect / country part.

data.title: Debug/Run should not autoclose console if console was open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. write a small js program that prints to the console
2. open console
3. run it using Ctrl+F5

Observe: you see the output and then the output closes after 1 second. That might be ok for debug but is annoying in run mode.

data.title: Support for Custom CompletionItemKind Icons
data.body:
I'm currently working on an extension for VS Code to add the functionality of another extension of mine that was created for Visual Studio: [Glyphfriend](https://github.com/Rionmonster/Glyphfriend). When I began working on this, I noticed that the `CompletionItemKinds` enum only seems to support a predefined set of values (e.g. `Value`,`Text`,`File`, etc.). 

Is there any way to currently set this glyph to a specific file? Or is there another preferred way that I should look at implementing this type of behavior (either via a different type of provider or through somehow extending the existing `CompletionItemKind` class)?

Any feedback or recommendations would be appreciated.

data.title: Save with Encoding shows 'UTF-8 (configured encoding)' while it is UTF with BOM
data.body:
- create a file
- click on the encoding in the status bar: 'Save with Encoding' to 'UTF-8 with BOM'
- again click on the encoding in the status bar: 'Save with Encoding': 
  The picker says 'UTF-8 (configured encoding)' -> should say 'UTF-8 with BOM (configured encoding)'

data.title: Repeated words in the task creation quick box
data.body:
Testing #4019 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13751917/a8dbc866-ea0c-11e5-82fc-27b332344991.png)
- Suggest to extract the prefix Creates a task.json to the message in the input box, e.g., `Pick a task template to create a 'task.json' configuration. 
- The other repeated text is 'if x is available with auto detection'. 
- Suggest to rename 'External Command' to 'Generic Command' to make it clear that this one for others. 

// @chrisdias

data.title: fix intellisense to make clear that "file path to language association" needs absolute path
data.body:
testing #3925
OS: Version

The "files.associations" setting for paths requires an **absolute** path. This does not become clear when reading the intellisense for file paths.

data.title: No progress and completion indication during task detection

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #4019 

(this is not a consquence of the new task creation)

When using task detection on our gulpfile in vscode then 
- there is no progress and it takes a while to launch gulp
- there is no information about what has been detected as the build and test task

data.title: file path to language association settings need window reload to work for existing files
data.body:
testing #3925
OS: Linux
- configure "file path to language association settings"

Observe: existing files that match the path or extension do not show the new language when opened in an editor.

If this cannot be fixed I suggest to add a comment like this: "This setting requires reload/restart of VSCode to take effect."

data.title: Indent using spaces shows wrong value for `Configured Tab Size`
data.body:
Testing #3922

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13750297/28c2bfa6-ea05-11e5-9fa5-7d201bd6733e.png)

The file is indented with spaces and the indentation size is 2. So I'd expect 2 to be the default selected option in that list.

Also, as per #3590, the label should be _Current Indentation Size_ to match that expectation.

data.title: Reduce the number of TS related templates
data.body:
Testing #4019

Do we really need 4 TypeScript entries? 

Suggest to remove the `TypeScript specific file` template it is a special case of `TypeScript open file`.

Do we really need `TypeScript open file`? 

// @chrisdias
